matched.actualTitle: XSS Bypass via onfocus Event Handler with Tab Whitespace
matched.matchReason: Both describe the same XSS vulnerability in /level13 with incomplete blacklist filtering. The actual finding demonstrates a specific bypass technique using onfocus event handler and tab whitespace that aligns with the expected finding's description of 'insufficient blacklist filtering' and 'alternative payload constructions'. The payload ><img%09src=x%09onfocus=alert("XSS")%09autofocus> directly confirms the vulnerability scenario described in the expected finding.

matched.actualTitle: XSS Bypass via SVG onload Event Handler with Tab Whitespace
matched.matchReason: Both describe the same XSS vulnerability in /level13 with blacklist bypass. This actual finding demonstrates another specific bypass technique using SVG onload handler and tab whitespace characters, which represents the 'alternative event handlers' bypass method mentioned in the expected finding's scenario. The payload ><svg%09onload=alert("XSS")> confirms the vulnerability and represents a second exploitation vector for the same underlying issue.

extra.title: Missing Critical Security Headers
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - not a false positive. This is a genuine security misconfiguration where the application lacks 6 critical security headers (X-Frame-Options, Content-Security-Policy, X-Content-Type-Options, X-XSS-Protection, Strict-Transport-Security, Referrer-Policy). These headers provide defense-in-depth protection and should be implemented. New discovery relevant to overall application security posture.

extra.title: Server Version Information Disclosure
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - not a false positive. The application exposes Werkzeug/3.1.3 and Python/3.13.3 version information through the Server header, enabling reconnaissance by attackers. While low severity, it violates defense-in-depth principles. New discovery relevant to information disclosure vulnerabilities.

extra.title: Missing Cache-Control Headers - Sensitive Content May Be Cached
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - not a false positive. The application lacks Cache-Control, Expires, and Pragma headers, allowing uncontrolled caching of potentially sensitive content. This is a genuine security misconfiguration that could lead to data exposure on shared systems. New discovery relevant to cache management and sensitive data handling.

extra.title: Insecure HTTP Protocol - No TLS/HTTPS Enforcement
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - not a false positive. The application is served over unencrypted HTTP without HTTPS/TLS enforcement or HSTS headers. This allows man-in-the-middle attacks and complete compromise of data confidentiality and integrity. This is a critical infrastructure security issue. New discovery relevant to transport layer security.

extra.title: Werkzeug 3.1.3 Debug Console Accessible - Arbitrary Python Code Execution
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - not a false positive. The Flask application is running with Werkzeug debug mode enabled with EVALEX=true, allowing arbitrary Python code execution. This is the most critical vulnerability discovered. The SECRET token and PIN are exposed, allowing complete remote code execution. New discovery that supersedes in severity all expected findings.

extra.title: Werkzeug Debugger PIN Disclosure - Predictable and Logged
extra.assessment: Valid security finding - not a false positive. The debugger PIN is logged in plaintext and has only ~1000 effective combinations despite the XXX-XXX-XXX format appearing to have more combinations. This makes brute-force attacks feasible and converts the debug mode into a trivial remote code execution vulnerability. New discovery directly related to the Werkzeug debug console accessibility.
